title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 79-6.3 - Professional licensing examinations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 79-6.3 - Professional licensing examinations

State Regulations
(a) Except as provided in section
79-6.4
of this Subpart, each
applicant for certification shall pass an examination that is determined by the
department to measure the applicant's knowledge of and judgment concerning
curricular areas as defined in section
52.25
of this Title and other
matters of ethics relating to practice as may be deemed appropriate by the
department. (b) Education
requirements for admission. Notwithstanding the provisions of section
59.2
of this Title, an applicant
for certification shall not be required to satisfy all education requirements
before being admitted to a professional licensing examination in dietetics and
nutrition. Such education shall be completed prior to certification. (c) Grade retention. The grade retention
limitations of section
59.5
(f) of this

Title shall not be applicable to a professional licensing examination in
dietetics and nutrition. (d) Passing standard. The passing standard for each examination shall be determined
by the board. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
79-6.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
